desc: KMT2B encodes the histone methyltransferase MLL4, an epigenetic modulator that methylates lysine residue 4 on the tail of histone H3 (H3K4). Methylation of H3K4 leads to increased genome accessibility, recruitment of transcriptional complexes, and activation of gene expression (PMID: 25998713). KMT2B methylates H3K4 at enhancer regions, leading to increased expression of target genes and changes in chromatin looping structures (PMID: 25998713, 28759003, 24368734). KMT2B plays a role in regulating cell cycle progression and cell viability and induces transcription of leukemic genes (PMID: 22713656). Unlike other KMT2 homolog genes, KMT2B is mutated at low frequencies in cancer (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Oct 2017).
articles/0/title: H3K4 mono- and di-methyltransferase MLL4 is required for enhancer activation during cell differentiation.
articles/1/title: MLL4 prepares the enhancer landscape for Foxp3 induction via chromatin looping.
articles/2/title: Mixed lineage leukaemia-4 regulates cell-cycle progression and cell viability and its depletion suppresses growth of xenografted tumour in vivo.
articles/3/title: Hijacked in cancer: the KMT2 (MLL) family of methyltransferases.

desc: KMT2B, a histone methyltransferase and transcriptional coactivator, is mutated at low frequencies in various tumors.
